block.p: Katya Kazakina and Greg Allen Goldberg were married last evening by Cantor Boris Kazansky at Blue Hill at Stone Barns in Pocantico Hills, N.Y.

The bride, 33, is keeping her name. She works at Bloomberg L.P., the financial news and information company in New York, where she writes a weekly column about Chelsea art galleries and produces segments for ''Muse,'' a weekly arts program on Bloomberg Television. She graduated from Barnard and received a master's in journalism from Columbia. She is the daughter of Elena Kazakina of East Brunswick, N.J., and the stepdaughter of Slava Kuteyev.
Katya Kazakina and Greg Allen Goldberg were married last evening by Cantor Boris Kazansky at Blue Hill at Stone Barns in Pocantico Hills, N.Y.
Katya Kazakina and Greg Allen Goldberg were married last evening by Cantor Boris Kazansky at Blue Hill at Stone Barns in Pocantico Hills, N.Y.

The bride, 33, is keeping her name. She works at Bloomberg L.P., the financial news and information company in New York, where she writes a weekly column about Chelsea art galleries and produces segments for ''Muse,'' a weekly arts program on Bloomberg Television. She graduated from Barnard and received a master's in journalism from Columbia. She is the daughter of Elena Kazakina of East Brunswick, N.J., and the stepdaughter of Slava Kuteyev.

The bridegroom, also 33, is an abstract painter who has eight works in the collection of the Museum of Modern Art in New York. He graduated magna cum laude from Skidmore. He is the son of Barbara and Steven Goldberg of New York.
